body_html:
You need to initialize the CheckpointSaverHook using the same graph as your variables.

import tensorflow as tf

graph = tf.Graph()
with graph.as_default():
    v = tf.get_variable("test", shape=(100, 100), dtype=tf.float32)
    save = tf.train.CheckpointSaverHook("test_dir", 10)

with graph.as_default():
    tf.train.create_global_step()
    a = tf.constant(1)
    with tf.train.MonitoredSession(hooks=[save]) as sess:
        sess.run(a)

print(tf.contrib.framework.list_variables("test_dir"))

prints [('test', [100, 100])].

body:
You need to initialize the `CheckpointSaverHook` using the same graph as your variables.

```python
import tensorflow as tf

graph = tf.Graph()
with graph.as_default():
    v = tf.get_variable("test", shape=(100, 100), dtype=tf.float32)
    save = tf.train.CheckpointSaverHook("test_dir", 10)

with graph.as_default():
    tf.train.create_global_step()
    a = tf.constant(1)
    with tf.train.MonitoredSession(hooks=[save]) as sess:
        sess.run(a)

print(tf.contrib.framework.list_variables("test_dir"))
```

prints `[('test', [100, 100])]`.
